citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, the atmospheric temperature exceeded 90 degrees Fahrenheit in an outdoor facility housing
twenty- eight adult rabbits. Approximately twenty of the rabbits were observed lying stretched out and with rapid breathing
rates. The recorded atmospheric temperature was 92.8 degrees Fahrenheit at 11:17 am. While the rabbit enclosures had
shade cloths and fans blowing air at each end of the facility, no additional cooling measures were observed where the
rabbits were resting. Failing to provide adequate cooling and relief from excessive temperatures can significantly
jeopardize the animals’ health and may even lead to death. The licensee shall provide adequate artificial cooling, such as
a sprinkler system or other means, when the atmospheric temperature exceeds 90 degrees Fahrenheit. Correct by
August 14,2023.

Metal feeders are used in the rabbit enclosures, many of the feeders have rusty surfaces and some of the feeders have
caked food in the mesh. The rust and corrosion inhibit proper cleaning and sanitation, potentially leading to food
contamination and causing illness in the animals. All food receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitized at least once
every two weeks. The licensee must ensure the feeders are repaired or replaced to protect the food from contamination.
Correct by August 18,2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.52(a)  Direct Repeat
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
At the time of inspection, the atmospheric temperature exceeded 90 degrees Fahrenheit in an outdoor facility housing 
twenty- eight adult rabbits. Approximately twenty of the rabbits were observed lying stretched out and with rapid breathing 
rates. The recorded atmospheric temperature was 92.8 degrees Fahrenheit at 11:17 am. While the rabbit enclosures had 
shade cloths and fans blowing air at each end of the facility, no additional cooling measures were observed where the 
rabbits were resting. Failing to provide adequate cooling and relief from excessive temperatures can significantly 
jeopardize the animals’ health and may even lead to death. The licensee shall provide adequate artificial cooling, such as 
a sprinkler system or other means, when the atmospheric temperature exceeds 90 degrees Fahrenheit. Correct by 
August 14,2023. 
3.54(b) 
   
Feeding. 
Metal feeders are used in the rabbit enclosures, many of the feeders have rusty surfaces and some of the feeders have 
caked food in the mesh. The rust and corrosion inhibit proper cleaning and sanitation, potentially leading to food 
contamination and causing illness in the animals. All food receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitized at least once 
every two weeks. The licensee must ensure the feeders are repaired or replaced to protect the food from contamination. 
Correct by August 18,2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
